text:
But even with these back to back hits, Neena thinks that she cannot be too choosy when it comes to work, but does the best from what is offered to her. Talking to IANS, Neena said, "Out of what offers I get, I do only those films which excite me... I am doing 'Panga,' it's a small role, but a nice one. I can't be so choosy. I do the best offers that come my way."
This Friday is an important day for Saif Ali Khan, whose film Bazaar is all set to hit the theatres. The screening of the film was held at a Mumbai theatre last night where we saw Bebo supporting her husband in the sweetest way possible. yes, she attended the screening too.
Hon Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi meets film industry delegation: Aamir Khan, Rajkumar Hirani, Aanand L Rai, Ritesh Sidhwani, Siddharth Roy Kapur, Maulik Bhagat and Mahaveer Jain... How entertainment industry can contribute more in nation building was discussed. pic.twitter.com/VKbWvhqnso — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) October 25, 2018
Don't Miss
Well, the outrage over this picture built up when people spotted that this panel didn't include even one single woman from the film industry.
"Where is Rima Das? Her movie is going for Oscars and she has not been included? wrote one user.
But do you think this exists only in Bollywood? Well, the answer sadly is no. In a recent interview with Republic TV, model-actor and fitness enthusiast Milind Soman was asked if he ever came across such incidents as a model. Talking about the same, he said, “Not really because when I started modeling, of course, everybody today talks about casting couch concept in films and fashion as well but when I started, fashion was such a new industry that all of us were starting out together so there was no position of power or something like that could encourage this kind of an incident. For me, I was never subjected to this but I know it exists because people talk to me about it."
Director said, "We had gone to Tabu ji for the role. At that time, we had a different script in mind and we wanted Tabu ma'am and Irrfan Khan sir. When she heard the script, she suggested Neenaji's name for her character. Tabu felt, perhaps rightly, that she looked like a woman who can still have a child."
title: Neena Gupta Is Back In The Game, Saif-Kareena Step Out For Bazaar Premiere And More From Ent
